intro: Acyntha metallica, commonly known as the metallic acyntha, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
